Header: Suicide bomber in Afghanistan targets election rally
Content: A suicide bomber blew himself up at an election rally in Afghanistanâ€™s eastern province of Nangarhar killing at least 13 people and wounding more than 30 warning that the toll is likely to climb. Campaigning for the October 20 parliamentary election began and security officials have warned of the danger of militant attacks during the campaigning. The spokesman of the provincial governor, Attaullah Khogyani, said at least 13 bodies were taken to hospitals, but others said the toll was likely to be higher. Around 250 people were attending the rally said Sohrab Qaderi, a member of the provincial council, adding that at least 30 were killed and dozens more wounded.
